title: Coronavirus Live Updates: Maharashtra reports 58,993 new cases and 301 deaths in the last 24 hours - The Economic Times
description: India registered a record single-day spike of 1,31,968 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, pushing its infection tally to 1,30,60,542, while the death toll increased to 1,67,642 with 780 more fatalities in a day, highest since October 18, the Union Health Ministry data showed.

title: Massive free temple campaign impact in Uttrakhand
description: Uttrakhand's chief minister has announced to free 51 temples from government control. The issue of the Devasthanam Board was discussed with the saints. He has decided to rethink the problem, and they will free 51 temples that have been put under the Devasthanam Board. The Devasthanam Board's point was discussed with the saints, and they have decided to rethink it. Justifying the creative act's passage, Tirath Singh Rawat has said the new show would help in the shrines' professional management. Priests and monks from the Himalayan state were furious with the BJP government for passing the law, saying they have been managing these temples' affairs for generations that their ancestors set up. Priest of the Gangotri shrine Rajnikant Semwal had even met Vishva Hindu Parishad and the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently announced â€˜Tika Utsavâ€™ between April 11 and 14 to vaccinate as many eligible people as possible against COVID-19. However, a recent report collated from the Union Health Ministry data has found that India has COVID-19 vaccine stock for 5.5 days on average at the current rate of vaccination, with just over 12 daysâ€™ worth in the pipeline. Several states, including Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand have less than three daysâ€™ stock presently.

title: Uttarakhand: Senior citizens walk for 8 km to get COVID-19 vaccine jab  | Latest News & Updates at DNAIndia.com
description: Uttarakhand: Senior citizens walk for 8 km to get COVID-19 vaccine jab  - Senior citizens residing in the far-flung area of Uttarakashi are forced to walk for 8 kilometers to get the COVID-19 vaccine jab from the health center. The route is risky for elderly people as they have to cross raw trails which are life-threatening. Locals have expressed their anger on the poor health management in the district. COVID-19 vaccination is underway across the country. Union Health Ministry reported that a total of 6,87,89,138 vaccinations have been inoculated till date.
